origins.title: 1908 May 19, Fairfield, to Lillie
origins.transc: Fairfield5-19-08Dear Lillie,I enclose for the new genealogy work, my check for $100, as I promised. I hope the has felt thee could write to John E. Carter one of thy pleasant letters, such as thee sent me -- I shall be surprised if he does not take an interest in the work and help it on. I have not found a good opportunity to speak to our Alfred about it -- his mind is absorbed in his beloved Porto Rico plans, I don't know how he will feel.Ever aff's thine  EW Garrett

origins.subjec: Poetry
origins.title: 1898 November 8, Woodbourne, to dear Cousin Clementine
origins.transc:
For dear Cousin Clementine

Clustering round thee, cousin mine,
Linger memories sweet -
Each, as tiny floweret hid,
Musing in quiet retreat;
E'en undiscovered and unseen
Neath tramp of busy feet,
Till suddenly it springs to light
In beauty most complete -
New, in a glory all its own,
Enfolding perfume sweet. Close, close around these hearts of ours O'er briars & ill weeds creeping, Peep forth the blue Forget-me-nots, Each fresh, as waked from sleeping. Woodbourne Nov 8th/98
